elements.2211.03145_2800101dcd5c2a9086f3a828034d2: Conoscopic interferometry is a promising detection technique for ultrafast acoustics
elements.2211.03145_3e116aebd6838065e097d6da7786c: By focusing a probe beam through a birefringent crystal before passing it through a polarizer, conoscopic interferences sculpt the spatial profile of the beam
elements.2211.03145_7ea2e7166db4373eb0e742d09f3ba: The use of these patterns for acoustic wave detection revealed a higher detection sensitivity over existing techniques, such as reflectometry and beam distortion detection
elements.2211.03145_1fc16f959939fb5859fae17805613: However, the physical origin of the increased sensitivity is unknown
elements.2211.03145_0d926bf7ae17e901367443b9191b6: In this work, we present a model, describing the sensitivity behaviour of conoscopic interferometry with respect to the quarter-wave plate orientation and the diaphragm aperture, which is validated experimentally
elements.2211.03145_531e35cd50ee423abb6ad457e1dd3: Using the model, we optimize the detection sensitivity of conoscopic interferometry
elements.2211.03145_9eddd4552617b2cfe603cf90b9eb5: We obtain a maximal sensitivity of detection when placing the diaphragm edge on the dark fringes of the conoscopic interference patterns
elements.2211.03145_9e3c00d121eef5a4daac0aa96b81b: In the configurations studied in this work, conoscopic interferometry can be 8x more sensitive to acoustic waves than beam distortion detection.
elements.2211.03145_558f46d191420df3b6795fa8a05ca: Photoacoustics uses pulsed lasers to excite high-frequency acoustic waves ranging from hundreds of kHz to hundreds of GHz
elements.2211.03145_4de6ab9ad6cdab4ced7486d4be8e6: , and for medical imaging and diagnosis
elements.2211.03145_11e963cd11efcf0b1c84cbdd07fe4: pulsed laser â the pump - generates bulk, guided, or surface acoustic waves in a sample of interest
elements.2211.03145_0fa8cb2f7e767374a14956a0644cb: The detection of the same acoustic waves with a second laser beam â the probe - enables non-contact measurements on samples with complex geometries, in tough environmental conditions, and without contaminating their surface
elements.2211.03145_59c357399dfb79f235dcfe3184203: The most common implementation for acoustic wave detection with lasers is reflectometry
elements.2211.03145_b5be21d8650ab2dd20f6150f2bd96: The strain associated with the acoustic waves changes the refractive index of the material through the photoelastic effect
elements.2211.03145_14ab401a85edb0cfc9c717978a92a: Hence, the power of the probe beam reflected from the material surface has a component directly proportional to the elastic strain
elements.2211.03145_a69b8441fdb5d221055c44233e8e6: The resulting relative variation in laser power is usually in the range of
elements.2211.03145_4295bbfd1069512f232b4615c6a5e: The photoelastic constants of the material at the probe laser wavelength set the detection sensitivity
elements.2211.03145_62851e3c13867f90d5e6e4f756efe: The strong dependence of the photoacoustic signal on the photoelastic constants limits the applicability of reflectometry and thus inspired the development of Beam Distortion Detection (BDD)
elements.2211.03145_294bb49804c0441f6861c2d1441f0: In BDD, the Gaussian spatial profile of the acoustic wave incident on the sample surface causes slight fluctuations in the divergence angle of the reflected probe beam
elements.2211.03145_d590c3aaea26e26d41a52cbb2bdc8: This results in diameter variations of the reflected probe beam that are proportional to the acoustic displacement, hence variations in power density
elements.2211.03145_2415f0647bdfc564984e7a1442c24: By masking a part of the probe beam with a diaphragm, the power measured with a photodetector becomes proportional to the displacement of the sample surface
elements.2211.03145_6c1686d085a7d098969e49dfcd87c: This technique has the advantage of a detection sensitivity
elements.2211.03145_371cbfe644aed4483543fc98ca353: of the properties of the sample material: BDD does allow the detection of acoustic waves in materials with very low photoelastic constants
elements.2211.03145_1545938bbebba6aa527a1ef7f3b0e: reported a clear improvement of the Signal-to-Noise Ratio (SNR) with respect to reflectometry
elements.2211.03145_acda2275daf2bcdcc972488299318: In general, the measured signal is a sum of the BDD and the reflectometry signal
elements.2211.03145_961fb4d6827a429149f5a7d0824c3: In materials with high photoelastic coefficients, BDD and reflectometry signals are therefore difficult to distinguish from each other
elements.2211.03145_48df491fb646c123b824d86d0418f: CI makes use of Conoscopic Interference Patterns (CIPs), which are well-known for the characterization of birefringent crystals
elements.2211.03145_387cb637ab2a346fc2ecf9c26dc96: By focusing the probe beam with a given polarization through a birefringent crystal and then collimating it before passing through a polarizer, one can obtain a succession of bright (isochromates) and dark (isogyres) fringes
elements.2211.03145_c03128d3bdd1f12b80eb8c40cf3f0: The fringes form a pattern characteristic of the birefringence properties of the crystal and the input and output polarizations
elements.2211.03145_e29afd9d1d47024571ba54d21ed8c: implemented this phenomenon in BDD by adding a birefringent crystal (sapphire plate) between the objective and the sample and by using a Polarizing Beam Splitter (PBS) as a polarizer to change the spatial profile of the probe beam to a CIP
elements.2211.03145_d77789902ce3cc4f0baa2071e8e22: The resulting CIP is controlled by rotating a quarter-wave plate placed between the PBS and the objective
elements.2211.03145_1f1191f9345ea4526402ecb32c24e: observed surprisingly high SNR for some CIPs, with respect to BDD and reflectometry in identical configurations on two different samples
elements.2211.03145_2c38ed59f5c2fec8efceec278124a: However, to this day, an analytical model that predicts the sensitivity of acoustic wave detection by CI is still missing
elements.2211.03145_c5dfdbb5d05ea872f66699fa7a186: This is of great interest in view of pushing the sensitivity higher to allow measurements of weak acoustic signals from thick structures, reflections from interface with low acoustic impedance mismatch, or materials with high acoustic damping
elements.2211.03145_09fdf11badc97509b86c0696d5108: In this paper, we present an analytical model for the CIPs and predict their sensitivity to acoustic waves
elements.2211.03145_0530bc2e1df475bc6b10eacdc6166: Using this model, we identified the key parameter to optimize the performance of CI: maxima of sensitivity is obtained by placing the diaphragm edges on the dark fringes (isogyres) of the CIPs
elements.2211.03145_feb7ccf30188f3f06d8c7d67a5999: In the configurations considered in this work, we found a sensitivity up to 8 times higher than that of BDD
elements.2211.03145_56de9b7b8b4e91d33e51bb9d7445f: We experimentally validate the model on a 2.4
elements.2211.03145_06900ecffeb9d084d97d7bf8a3141: m thick silicon plate (Si) coated with
elements.2211.03145_2bf65c585fc251f44dd9425ac4b38: nm aluminum (Al) indicating that the model correctly predicts the sensitivity of CI to acoustic waves.
elements.2211.03145_a7fd289f7c51d97a2119bacf33405: The experimental setup, shown in Figure
elements.2211.03145_cc9b8283d9ba4f7b0244d6c076e0d: , contains an ASynchronous OPtical Sampling (ASOPS) system
elements.2211.03145_359ba888c75ed8bb42c2790a0a788: consisting of two synchronized Erbium lasers from Menlo Systems with a pulse duration of around 100 fs
elements.2211.03145_175c7b29bd1f148957eea8c8e71ad: The pump pulses locally heat the sample, which results in an extremely short temperature increase and to the thermomechanical generation of a longitudinal acoustic pulse
elements.2211.03145_33a32aa6551dec1e9e81e1323fa1b: in a bandwidth of a few tens of GHz (
elements.2211.03145_587fb3e8de7baa91e3302334ad7c8: The probe pulses allow us to measure the acoustic reflections arriving back at the surface of the sample
elements.2211.03145_527088ab3f4c9eb7ffc5fa0a53cd8: The pump laser has a wavelength of 1560 nm, a repetition rate of 100 MHz, and an average output power of around 100 mW
elements.2211.03145_59d4199d8829868edc3e43617d33a: The probe laser has a wavelength of 780 nm, an average output power of
elements.2211.03145_948e9874268590f1fe9e9aaf19aa4: kHz lower repetition rate than the pump laser
elements.2211.03145_ee08fabedcb175845d73504d6caa7: This offset in repetition rate allows the reconstruction of the 10 ns time window between two pump pulses within 100
elements.2211.03145_f10eaaea00c386061bd6dbad58274: The time window is thus probed with
elements.2211.03145_0a422e911fbf2c2cd7642ca32304a: discrete time samples and consequently offers a temporal resolution of 1 ps
elements.2211.03145_55db5d11e05ce16fc7ea63df68c36: In this section, we describe the experimental setup by introducing successively the paths of the pump beam, probe beam and the illumination of the sample as well as the data acquisition and measurement methodologies.
elements.2211.03145_886c114837441fac10228ca2bcbaf: The pump beam fiber output is first collimated by a collimator and reflected at 90Â° by a Short-Pass (SP) 950 nm dichroic mirror to make a common path with the probe beam
elements.2211.03145_84e9aa689bf925913ed8c92680736: The P-polarized component is transmitted by a polarized beam splitter (PBS) and then crosses a Quarter-Wave Plate (QWP) before it is focused on the sample through a sapphire plate by an objective
elements.2211.03145_a67aef9101ada3756d337e8d0ebcb: The near-infrared long working distance Plan-Apochromat objective from Mitutoyo has a magnification of 20 and a wavelength correction from visible range to 1800 nm
elements.2211.03145_bbb8210451b6977955427f2d644ce: A part of the pump beam reflected off the sample is redirected towards a camera using a Beam Splitter (BS) for aligning the pump and probe beam
elements.2211.03145_6b6e25d6bfb3da39685cd0efe8703: The radius of the pump beam, defined by the Half Width Half Maximum (HWHM) of the intensity, is estimated as
elements.2211.03145_d1a4470cad64fa2b4328d854861ff: mm directly after the collimator and
elements.2211.03145_46e5191c6fc1363d9c8a69a661447: m on a sample in focus.
elements.2211.03145_a4713eeb4138568862d57891ae3e5: The probe beam is free-space and first passes through a Half-Wave Plate (HWP) to make it P-polarized
elements.2211.03145_7452dcba8b7fd41cadedafb0ba6cb: This maximizes the power transmitted by the PBS
elements.2211.03145_a8565805acc46c2161b86a9e251e5: Before crossing the PBS, the probe beam travels through two dichroic mirrors; a Long-Pass (LP) with a cut-off wavelength of 650 nm and the SP with a cut-off wavelength of 950 nm
elements.2211.03145_5d4c47050d4124ba6e13a177a2036: We place these dichroic mirrors before the PBS to avoid any shift in polarization of the probe beam after the PBS as this would affect the CIPs
elements.2211.03145_aeca8652202ca476be4a9176c3536: After crossing the PBS, we place a QWP to controllably rotate the probe beam polarization
elements.2211.03145_22fdccd0433ee450bff24c18ae367: The objective focuses the probe beam on the sample through a 1 mm thick C-axis cut (0001) birefringent sapphire plate, which modifies the beam polarization and gives it a spatial dependence
elements.2211.03145_db2ee42a7f61a53b037a41a048e9f: After reflection of the probe beam by the sample, it passes again through the sapphire plate, the objective, and the QWP
elements.2211.03145_d90b28a841b3aa3f342055f97dcd2: Now, the PBS acts as a polarizer and reflects the S-polarized component only towards the detection arm of the setup
elements.2211.03145_1e9e3d055f49d8d44af999926949f: In the detection arm, a BS splits the probe beam into two beams of equal power
elements.2211.03145_ef68aff818cca62f582e33b849185: One of these beams is focused on a camera, to visualize the CIPs and to align the pump and probe beam on the sample
elements.2211.03145_fb46c91f54af93b67f31ff65764fa: The other beam is truncated by an iris diaphragm, of which the aperture diameter can be set between 0.4 mm and 8 mm
elements.2211.03145_1276954bfd4c9fcebbc76aff5413f: This diaphragm is used to detect the acoustic waves in a BDD or CI configuration
elements.2211.03145_c14b3f98276c44f88a7212b00dce8: After the diaphragm, the probe beam is focused on a photodetector to ensure a spot size smaller than the photosensitive area and thereby avoid additional truncation of the beam
elements.2211.03145_e53f215088dc34643b6724d3d6073: The probe beam radius (HWHM) is estimated as
elements.2211.03145_88e4d7f0525d72168ffce1193e30f: mm directly at the laser output and
elements.2211.03145_fcb1aff90ec15ba6fd13416a929af: A white LED array illuminates the sample to localize the pump and probe beam spots with respect to the sample
elements.2211.03145_ce2821b2694230d41e94c39304beb: The white light of the LED is first collimated to a beam by the use of a lens and a diaphragm
elements.2211.03145_9dc354fd6bd8b42e1b593e00dc048: This allows us to control the white beamâs diameter and power by adjusting its aperture
elements.2211.03145_9efa18758809f961b28448eb11e7a: A lens with a long focal length then focuses the white beam to avoid loss of power by truncation on the aperture of the other optical components in the setup
elements.2211.03145_625d5095ee7e15e81533a41b79a67: Before reaching the sample, the white beam is first reflected with an angle of 90Â° by the LP 650 nm dichroic mirror and then crosses the SP dichroic mirror, the PBS, the QWP, the objective, and the sapphire plate
elements.2211.03145_0b82e6490939c3f4c6f3ed7eb2e6f: The white beam is then reflected by the surface of the sample and crosses the sapphire plate, the objective, the QWP, and the PBS before moving into the detection arm of the setup
elements.2211.03145_1abc241be5c706de9bae7c51e93de: Part of the white beam is reflected by the BS and is focused on the camera to visualize the position of the pump and probe spots with respect to the sample.
elements.2211.03145_358fd94c127adb25787e6c0d7525d: We detect the probe beam pulses using a Si amplified photodetector from Menlo System (FPD510-FS-VIS) that is sensitive in a wavelength range from 400 nm to 1000 nm and has a bandwidth of 250 MHz
elements.2211.03145_6423f0f0387772951eb5d7854ea3a: The photosensitive area of the photodetector has a diameter of 0.4 mm
elements.2211.03145_ec967815cc199082678eccd4e75ea: The signal coming from the photodetector is processed by a lock-in amplifier (Ultra High Frequency Lock-In amplifier from ZÃ¼rich Instruments, 600 MHz bandwidth) with the Boxcar + Periodic Waveform Analyzer function
elements.2211.03145_8b564c7ba167a60269d9bbe33eb56: This allows the accurate reconstruction of the individual probe pulses
elements.2211.03145_80e564262d3a853b4a913a24cecf8: By using a trigger signal from the ASOPS system at a frequency equal to the difference in the repetition rate between both lasers (
elements.2211.03145_be890dd5b58cca0da25e996e6adc1: kHz), we probe the full-time delay window from 0 to 10 ns
elements.2211.03145_41430f2b9a8044d6ed30ff8ada964: The measured signals correspond to a variation in the probe pulse power induced by the response of the sample
elements.2211.03145_61a46bab90728440ae1d6b1a9b13b: We normalize these signals by dividing them by the probe power incident on the photodetector when the diaphragm is fully open.

elements.2211.03145_18b167de88c0805d904a973560161: All maxima in the sensitivity correspond to an aperture with the edges of the diaphragm placed in the isogyres (dark fringes)
elements.2211.03145_03ef735254b1a30ab88f975fe667d: The minima exactly occur when the diaphragm edges are on top of the bright fringes (isochromates)
elements.2211.03145_f875f3f71559e00d24e4cfa07d3b6: To find out why the sensitivity is maximum (minimum) at the isogyres (isochromates), we show the intensity difference
elements.2211.03145_f8d1a257321d566e88b24b6c16bbc: between a pattern with and without acoustic wave (see Equation
elements.2211.03145_695ba0ad3b497860d4b122891fd32: The acoustic waves induce a variation in the CIP due to the slight change in divergence angle as well as a change in
elements.2211.03145_c9a4941306a01ec68db45f6219913: The sign of this intensity variation is alternatingly positive and negative
elements.2211.03145_7072212fecb7e8876c874f00df11d: By placing the diaphragm edges on the isochromates of the CIP, the same number of positive and negative variations are incident on the photodetector
elements.2211.03145_7d1b494d6876a68205cec87bbf2c4: As we integrate this CIP over the open area of the diaphragm, the light intensity variation partly cancels out and thus results in a minimal sensitivity
elements.2211.03145_3003872df72c08eb46c8317374e9c: In contrast, by placing the diaphragm edges on the dark fringes of the CIP, more positive than negative variations of intensity are obtained, resulting in a maximum sensitivity to acoustic waves
elements.2211.03145_a9203094351d38bd885ae42abba93: Finally, we compare the sensitivity of CI with that of BDD
elements.2211.03145_a0d6900dbe33d6f135af82c3a0ae0: shows, CI is not always more sensitive than BDD
elements.2211.03145_7de3581467eeaf91e551e32ab1d85: However, by choosing the right diaphragm opening and QWP orientation, CI can be made more sensitive than BDD
elements.2211.03145_e22570a9b425f0f838af458c38265: For example, the CI configuration with
elements.2211.03145_9a1166d0be52c129cd49c8059f95c: , has a total sensitivity almost twice that of BDD
elements.2211.03145_2da43c25406f538451329b7d6dc19: The total sensitivity of CI configuration with
elements.2211.03145_de27a28f6244c07d2d51e0edf99b8: 0Â°, and no diaphragm, is even up to 8 times higher than that of BDD.
elements.2211.03145_12498b49e539ad9275925700c602f: Conoscopic Interferometry (CI) is a promising detection technique for ultrafast acoustics that can offer an improved SNR compared to Beam Distortion Detection (BDD) and reflectometry
elements.2211.03145_541bb1786e68417224bee91b3250b: We developed a model that predicts the sensitivity of CI and BDD
elements.2211.03145_7f8a21d3306b1d9f53c11f6f3ed20: Our results show that for a given probe power incident on the photodetector, CI can be more sensitive than BDD for detecting the surface displacement of a sample, if one carefully chooses the right parameters
elements.2211.03145_3383705c07e92ac3a4d489f30757b: By using a 1 mm thick sapphire plate, a probe beam radius of 0.4 mm, a Quarter Wave Plate orientation of 0Â° and no diaphragm, CI is up to 8 times more sensitive than BDD
elements.2211.03145_bcfc52394b4ab6a6f4d49a878fe46: Moreover, we showed that the CI sensitivity is optimal when the diaphragm aperture cuts the radially symmetric conoscopic interference patterns in its dark fringes
elements.2211.03145_c9ef08589f29f3f2cc7a493ba35dd: We validated these observations experimentally on a 2.4
elements.2211.03145_7fdd2ef398a1104b6ce02e98913e2: m thick silicon substrate coated with
elements.2211.03145_12a3bb76a0e4ea72d0031467f2fa0: We foresee significant improvements of the CI detection sensitivity by using different birefringent crystals, by beam shaping the probe beam, or using different diaphragm geometries
elements.2211.03145_4ea31d23c3b4db6a9999b0d5999e7: Because of the enhanced sensitivity compared to BDD and reflectometry on materials with low photoelastic constants, optimized CI detection schemes could play a central role in the future of ultrafast acoustics.

elements.2211.03145_623fb0dc8957418f99aca18e0b679: received his PhD degree in the field of Laser-Ultrasonics at the UniversitÃ© Polytechnique des Hauts-de-France, France, 2019, after obtaining his M.Sc. degree in acoustics at Le Mans UniversitÃ©, France, 2015
elements.2211.03145_3b4e7a619853044cb4fef7942d0e1: His doctorate work was about the characterization of the adhesion in film-on-substrate using Surface Acoustic Wave, generated and detected by lasers
elements.2211.03145_61babcafce424c1ad2e716b6662f9: He then pursued as a postdoctoral researcher at the Technische Universiteit Delft, Netherlands, between 2020 and 2022
elements.2211.03145_fe6142b0b891a509bfff2fe16b277: There, he worked on the design and installation of a Picosecond Ultrasonic setup for imaging and Non-Destructive Testing applications
elements.2211.03145_2e5ce48a1aee3cc3abaca76f0252f: He is now employed as a postdoctoral researcher at Institut LumiÃ¨re MatiÃ¨re, UniversitÃ© Claude Bernard Lyon 1, France, to characterize bio-metamaterials by Surface Acoustic Waves using Laser-Ultrasonics.
elements.2211.03145_c962e3074883ca7167a817e8f5c81: obtained his master's degree in Physics at Leiden University, Netherlands in 2020
elements.2211.03145_d213f01b7cf65e3cc6dff089d9d4e: For his thesis project he worked towards 3D imaging at the nanoscale by attempting to measure the subsurface information using resonant hydrogen spins in Magnetic Resonance Force Microscopy
elements.2211.03145_d8f0ded89d0364fd687ec62031e24: Started in October 2020, he is currently doing his PhD at the Technische Universiteit Delft, Netherlands, where he is again working on 3D imaging at the nanoscale, this time using ultrasound to get the subsurface information, by integrating nanoscale acoustics into atomic force microscopy.
elements.2211.03145_15a23e6b482401bdaae74f411de13: received the B.Sc. degree (2011) in Electrical
elements.2211.03145_2f6744677d763175a7cc01577748e: Electronics Engineering from the Middle East Technical University (METU), Ankara, Turkey
elements.2211.03145_7b508b5360ba1db2d2772c71ebc52: Next, he joined the Medical Imaging Lab. in the Institute of Biomedical Engineering, BogaziÃ§i University (BOUN), Istanbul and obtained the M.Sc. degree in Biomedical Engineering (2013)
elements.2211.03145_32d4e85ab101d18a48337a555285c: He pursued his Ph.D. in the Photoacoustics and Ultrasound Laboratory of Eindhoven (PULS/e Lab), in the Cardiovascular Biomechanics group of the department of Biomedical Engineering in the Eindhoven University of Technology, The Netherlands
elements.2211.03145_4a80ae0d2ddb325b4a8d91deec27e: His research focused on photoacoustic imaging of carotid arteries and fundamental characterization and preclinical validation of photoacoustic imaging (2018)
elements.2211.03145_a13f321a46e08e2aefb344bcf9ca0: Currently, he is working as a Research Scientist at ASML with the focus on semiconductor metrology.
elements.2211.03145_c1c7886179232c653f803ae47bd23: obtained his Masterâs degree of Optical Engineering from Chinese Academy of Sciences, Shanghai, China, in 2010
elements.2211.03145_36ed80d70475a83b1687a8f12501b: Then he received his PhD degree from Applied Physics department of Eindhoven University of Technology, the Netherlands, in 2014, where he focused on multi-photon detection with superconducting nanowires
elements.2211.03145_c3374f9c790206eb9f33243b095f2: Since 2015, he works at Research department of ASML on optical nanometrology projects, as a senior research scientist.
elements.2211.03145_490f5cbd0f1344729bc6be6080bc4: (PhD 2011, NUI Maynooth) is a Principal Research Engineer working at the Advanced Technology Development group at ASML
elements.2211.03145_7b9d85d43e13cf1bda1a8cef29636: He joined ASML in 2011 and has worked on various topics related to Optical sensors in Lithography scanners and Overlay metrology
elements.2211.03145_ae054ecb7d0a006c52dbd9f3afb04: He is currently working in the area of pattern fidelity control, OPC and stochastic placement error modelling.
elements.2211.03145_a60a298b788b4c92fc1da2f331c90: obtained his M.Sc. degree in theoretical physics (cum laude, 2009), and a PhD in experimental physics (2013) from Leiden University
elements.2211.03145_69f7dc1a594be9c1ebf05984cab47: His doctorate work focused on the application of ultrasound at MHz frequencies in atomic force microscopes to enable subsurface atomic force microscopy
elements.2211.03145_cb9d21aab2b7400d5ccd1127d0052: He then worked as postdoctoral researcher at the RWTH Aachen in Germany between 2013 and 2018 on graphene mechanics and dynamics
elements.2211.03145_fb2e6d3517af47359971263c0f49a: Since August 2018, Gerard works as assistant professor at the Delft University of Technology
elements.2211.03145_5c3d7841b82500f04d662b7657907: His work focusses on nanoscale acoustics with applications in atomic force microscopes, graphene and other two-dimensional materials, and plant physiology.
